list_definition.definition: a box etc where bees live and store up honey

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He’s building a hive so that he can keep bees.

list_definition.definition: the bees that live in such a place

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The whole hive flew after the queen bee.

list_ex_of_english: What will happen, therefore, in the case of those individual companies who want to carry out hiving off operations?
In doing so, they will know that the profits that they produce at their pits will be hived off to subsidise the electricity industry.
I was on the point of saying that a great many people fear that this is a halfway house to further hiving off.
He objects to the authorities that are to be created for the purpose of examining and discovering diseased hives.
They are especially concerned about resettlement and redundancy arrangements that might occur as a result of hiving off any part of the corporation.
Across a very broad section of public industry the threat of hiving off profitable parts is very real.
Is not the work about to be hived off to an agency?
No matter what the service, until the charges were introduced there was no easy way of hiving off particular services.
